newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia to sell 25 pct of Svyazinvest mid-May.
newsitem.headline: Russia to sell 25 pct of Svyazinvest mid-May.

text.p: Russia will sell 25 pct of AO Svyazinvest state telecoms holding company at a cash auction in mid-May, State Property Committee chairman Alfred Kokh said on Thursday.

Kokh had said earlier this month that the stake would be auctioned some time this year at a starting price of $1.1 billion. He said on Thursday that there would be no restrictions on which companies could bid for the stake.
Kokh told a conference that Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin on Thursday signed a draft decree on Svyazinvest sales and President Boris Yeltsin would receive it on Friday.

"The draft provides for sales of 25 percent of shares in AO Svyazinvest in a single lot at a cash auction in the amount of 25 percent plus one share without restrictions on residents and non-residents participation," Kokh said.
He said the revenue from the sales would be between $1.5 and $2.0 billion.
"If we sell the lot successfully, we shall overfulfill the budget target (for privatisation revenues) twofold," he said.
He said the starting price of the stake could be changed.
"Today we suppose the starting price to be $1.1 billion," he said. "To participate one is to make a $400 million pre-payment. But this is now, it can be changed later."
Svyazinvest is one of the government's privatisation targets this year.
The company has controlling stakes in 85 regional telecommunications companies.
